availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Eli Mullins (Pendleton County, Kentucky, hotel keeper and postmaster)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, hotel keeper and postmaster. Kentucky native. Married to Declina Mullins. Father of Zachariah Mullins, William H. Mullins, Mary H. Mullins, and Enos Mullins. Hotel keeper in Pendleton County in 1860. Postmaster of De Mossville, Kentucky, from 1861 to 1865.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 39; Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 163, (accessed via Ancestry.com).
